clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Melasma Relapse During Summertime
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Melasma Relapse During Summertime

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre de Pharmacologie Clinique Applique a la Dermatologie

clinical_study.source: Centre de Pharmacologie Clinique Applique a la Dermatologie

brief_summary.textblock: Main objective is to show that a photoprotective sunscreen having a protection against the visible light is more effective than a sunscreen having the same UVA AND UVB protection but with a low (weak) protection against the visible, to prevent the relapses of the melasma during the summertime.

detailed_description.textblock:
40 melasma affected women will be included and randomized in two parallel groups (one group protected by a UVA+UVB+visible extended sunscreen and one group group protected by a UVA+UVB sunscreen).
There will be 3 visits: Baseline, T2.5months and T5months (final visit).
Products application frequency: twice daily(morning and afternoon) and additional applications every 2 hours in case of solar exposure.
Main evaluation criterion: the MASI score assessed from standardized photographs (system VISIA, Canfield Scientific, USA) at Baseline, middle and end of study.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison between MASI scores before prevention treatment and after 6 months
primary_outcome.description: MASI scores are evaluated by two physicians blinded to the treatment received on standardized pictures taken before treatment and after 6 months of summer period

arm_group.description: UVA, UVB and visible light protection (exactly the same UVA and UVB protection as the comparator)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Melasma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other pigmentary disorders associated (including PIH)
